intro: Humiriastrum glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and white, fragrant flowers. The plant relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while it provides nectar for pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its unique ecological role makes it an important component of its native ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a species of conservation concern.
